revision.comment: Insertion of Former Minister Shidhatha Shareef
revision.text: '''Shidhatha Shareef''' id the former Minister of Gender and Social Security of Maldives. She was also the Deputy Minister of Ministry of Health and Council Member of the Adhaalath Party.
'''Shidhatha Shareef''' is the former Minister of Gender and Social Security of Maldives. She was also the Deputy Minister of Ministry of Health and Council Member of the [[Adhaalath Party]].
'''Shidhatha Shareef''' is the former Minister of Gender and Social Security of [[Maldives]]. She was also the Deputy Minister of Ministry of Health and Council Member of the [[Adhaalath Party]].

'''Shidhatha Shareef''' is the former Minister of Gender and Social Security of [[Maldives]]. She was also the Deputy Minister of Ministry of Health and Council Member of the [[Adhaalath Party]].
==Political Career==

'''Shidhatha Shareef''' is the former Minister of Gender and Social Security of [[Maldives]]. She was also the Deputy Minister of Ministry of Health and Council Member of the [[Adhaalath Party]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://maldivesindependent.com/politics/parliament-approves-cabinet-with-overwhelming-majority-143049 |title=Parliament approves cabinet with overwhelming majority |author=Maldives Independent |date=4 December 2018}}</ref>
Shidhatha is a human rights Advocate and resigned stating that the Government is not facilitating and assisting in the reform.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/23065 |title=President accepts the resignation of Shidhatha Shareef |author=Presidents Office |date=6 February 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.wionews.com/south-asia/proactively-promoting-women-leadership-says-maldives-minister-of-social-services-shidhatha-shareef-193798 |title=Proactively promoting women leadership: Maldives minister Shidhatha Shareef |author=Wio News |date=30 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.foreign.gov.mv/index.php/en/mediacentre/news/4890-the-delegation-from-the-un-office-of-the-high-commissioner-for-human-rights-concludes-their-visit-to-the-maldives |title=The Delegation from the UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights concludes their visit to the Maldives |author=Ministry of Foreign Affairs |date=7 March 2020}}</ref>

'''Shidhatha Shareef''' is the former Minister of Gender and Social Security of [[Maldives]]. She was also the Deputy Minister of Ministry of Health and Council Member of the [[Adhaalath Party]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://maldivesindependent.com/politics/parliament-approves-cabinet-with-overwhelming-majority-143049 |title=Parliament approves cabinet with overwhelming majority |author=Maldives Independent |date=4 December 2018}}</ref>
Shidhatha is a human rights Advocate and resigned stating that the Government is not facilitating and assisting in the reform.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/23065 |title=President accepts the resignation of Shidhatha Shareef |author=Presidents Office |date=6 February 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.wionews.com/south-asia/proactively-promoting-women-leadership-says-maldives-minister-of-social-services-shidhatha-shareef-193798 |title=Proactively promoting women leadership: Maldives minister Shidhatha Shareef |author=Wio News |date=30 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.foreign.gov.mv/index.php/en/mediacentre/news/4890-the-delegation-from-the-un-office-of-the-high-commissioner-for-human-rights-concludes-their-visit-to-the-maldives |title=The Delegation from the UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights concludes their visit to the Maldives |author=Ministry of Foreign Affairs |date=7 March 2020}}</ref>

{{DEFAULTSORT:Shidhatha, Shareef}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]]

'''Shidhatha Shareef''' is the former Minister of Gender and Social Security of [[Maldives]]. She was also the Deputy Minister of Ministry of Health and Council Member of the [[Adhaalath Party]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://maldivesindependent.com/politics/parliament-approves-cabinet-with-overwhelming-majority-143049 |title=Parliament approves cabinet with overwhelming majority |author=Maldives Independent |date=4 December 2018}}</ref>
Shidhatha is a human rights advocate and resigned as Minister of Gender, Family and Social Security stating that the Government is not facilitating and assisting in the reform.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/23065 |title=President accepts the resignation of Shidhatha Shareef |author=Presidents Office |date=6 February 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.wionews.com/south-asia/proactively-promoting-women-leadership-says-maldives-minister-of-social-services-shidhatha-shareef-193798 |title=Proactively promoting women leadership: Maldives minister Shidhatha Shareef |author=Wio News |date=30 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.foreign.gov.mv/index.php/en/mediacentre/news/4890-the-delegation-from-the-un-office-of-the-high-commissioner-for-human-rights-concludes-their-visit-to-the-maldives |title=The Delegation from the UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights concludes their visit to the Maldives |author=Ministry of Foreign Affairs |date=7 March 2020}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Shidhatha, Shareef}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]]

'''Shidhatha Shareef''' is the former Minister of Gender and Social Security of [[Maldives]]. She was also the Deputy Minister of Ministry of Health and Council Member of the [[Adhaalath Party]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://maldivesindependent.com/politics/parliament-approves-cabinet-with-overwhelming-majority-143049 |title=Parliament approves cabinet with overwhelming majority |author=Maldives Independent |date=4 December 2018}}</ref>
Shidhatha is a human rights advocate and resigned as Minister of Gender, Family and Social Security stating that the [[Government]] is not facilitating and assisting in the reform agenda.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/23065 |title=President accepts the resignation of Shidhatha Shareef |author=Presidents Office |date=6 February 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.wionews.com/south-asia/proactively-promoting-women-leadership-says-maldives-minister-of-social-services-shidhatha-shareef-193798 |title=Proactively promoting women leadership: Maldives minister Shidhatha Shareef |author=Wio News |date=30 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.foreign.gov.mv/index.php/en/mediacentre/news/4890-the-delegation-from-the-un-office-of-the-high-commissioner-for-human-rights-concludes-their-visit-to-the-maldives |title=The Delegation from the UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights concludes their visit to the Maldives |author=Ministry of Foreign Affairs |date=7 March 2020}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Shidhatha, Shareef}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]]

'''Shidhatha Shareef''' is the former Minister of Gender and Social Security of [[Maldives]]. She was the Deputy Minister of Ministry of Health in the President [[Abdulla Yameen]]'s Presidency and Council Member of the [[Adhaalath Party]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://maldivesindependent.com/politics/parliament-approves-cabinet-with-overwhelming-majority-143049 |title=Parliament approves cabinet with overwhelming majority |author=Maldives Independent |date=4 December 2018}}</ref>
Shidhatha is a human rights advocate and resigned as Minister of Gender, Family and Social Security stating that the [[Government]] is not facilitating and assisting in the reform agenda.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/23065 |title=President accepts the resignation of Shidhatha Shareef |author=Presidents Office |date=6 February 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.wionews.com/south-asia/proactively-promoting-women-leadership-says-maldives-minister-of-social-services-shidhatha-shareef-193798 |title=Proactively promoting women leadership: Maldives minister Shidhatha Shareef |author=Wio News |date=30 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.foreign.gov.mv/index.php/en/mediacentre/news/4890-the-delegation-from-the-un-office-of-the-high-commissioner-for-human-rights-concludes-their-visit-to-the-maldives |title=The Delegation from the UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights concludes their visit to the Maldives |author=Ministry of Foreign Affairs |date=7 March 2020}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Shidhatha, Shareef}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]]

revision.comment: Leesaaisath moved page [[Draft:Shidhatha Shareef]] to [[Shidhatha Shareef]]: Insertion of former Minister Shidhatha Shareef
revision.text:
'''Shidhatha Shareef''' is the former Minister of Gender and Social Security of [[Maldives]]. She was the Deputy Minister of Ministry of Health in the President [[Abdulla Yameen]]'s Presidency and Council Member of the [[Adhaalath Party]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://maldivesindependent.com/politics/parliament-approves-cabinet-with-overwhelming-majority-143049 |title=Parliament approves cabinet with overwhelming majority |author=Maldives Independent |date=4 December 2018}}</ref>
Shidhatha is a human rights advocate and resigned as Minister of Gender, Family and Social Security stating that the [[Government]] is not facilitating and assisting in the reform agenda.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/23065 |title=President accepts the resignation of Shidhatha Shareef |author=Presidents Office |date=6 February 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.wionews.com/south-asia/proactively-promoting-women-leadership-says-maldives-minister-of-social-services-shidhatha-shareef-193798 |title=Proactively promoting women leadership: Maldives minister Shidhatha Shareef |author=Wio News |date=30 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.foreign.gov.mv/index.php/en/mediacentre/news/4890-the-delegation-from-the-un-office-of-the-high-commissioner-for-human-rights-concludes-their-visit-to-the-maldives |title=The Delegation from the UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights concludes their visit to the Maldives |author=Ministry of Foreign Affairs |date=7 March 2020}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Shidhatha, Shareef}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]]

'''Shidhatha Shareef''' is the former Minister of Gender and Social Security of [[Maldives]]. She was the Deputy Minister of Ministry of Health in the President [[Abdulla Yameen]]'s Presidency and Council Member of the [[Adhaalath Party]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://maldivesindependent.com/politics/parliament-approves-cabinet-with-overwhelming-majority-143049 |title=Parliament approves cabinet with overwhelming majority |author=Maldives Independent |date=4 December 2018}}</ref>
Shidhatha is a human rights advocate and resigned as Minister of Gender, Family and Social Security stating that the [[Government]] is not facilitating and assisting in the reform agenda.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/23065 |title=President accepts the resignation of Shidhatha Shareef |author=Presidents Office |date=6 February 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.wionews.com/south-asia/proactively-promoting-women-leadership-says-maldives-minister-of-social-services-shidhatha-shareef-193798 |title=Proactively promoting women leadership: Maldives minister Shidhatha Shareef |author=Wio News |date=30 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.foreign.gov.mv/index.php/en/mediacentre/news/4890-the-delegation-from-the-un-office-of-the-high-commissioner-for-human-rights-concludes-their-visit-to-the-maldives |title=The Delegation from the UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights concludes their visit to the Maldives |author=Ministry of Foreign Affairs |date=7 March 2020}}</ref>
